full_text:
This. Someone in the #nflverse had a number. I believe it was 90% of teams who won the toss won the game, with 70% of those teams scoring on the first drive. 

Defense wins championships, sure; but to think even the #1 def will play like such after 1hr in the cold is foolish. https://t.co/q4Yrou4RxE

After Sunday, the Rams are now the team that Tom Brady has struggled against the most.

He has a career EPA/play of +0.05 in nine games against the Rams (four vs STL, five vs LA)

Data: #nflverse https://t.co/Z3aJxOgBIs

If my code is right I've got 30 times that 2 teams have faced each other 3 times in the same season since 2000. A Rams win would be the first time a team won after losing the first 2 games. But the first 2 games don't paint a great picture for the Rams.

data: #nflverse https://t.co/NSH2dmTviX

Blended together fantasy points and player age to look at some cool trends.

#nflverse https://t.co/1eaY8x7gJu

and here's the same view, but looking at 'starter points', defined as 'fantasy points above the replacement player' in a 12 team league (so compares all QBs to whatever the 13th ranked QB scored that week, etc)

#nflverse https://t.co/pjjflKkxgd
